NewsDetail.Name: 01-13-11 Eliza R. Snow Award
NewsDetail.Title: Retired employee receives prestigious award
NewsDetail.Abstract: BYU-Idaho retired employee Charles W. West is the recipient of the 2011 Eliza R. Snow Award.
NewsDetail.Author: Writer: Andy Cargal
NewsDetail.BodyCopy:
Brigham Young University-Idaho retired employee Charles W. West is the recipient of the 2011 Eliza R. Snow Award.


Each year, the Eliza R. Snow Society for the Performing and Visual Arts recognizes an individual who has excelled in the performing and visual arts. The recipient must also be an alumnus or a former employee of the university and be supportive of its programs.


"When I heard I received the award I was pleasantly surprised," said West. "I absolutely loved working with all the different students. It was the frosting on the cake to see them excel at what they loved."


A faculty member at BYU-Idaho for 37 years, West was an instructor and mentor for approximately 23,000 students. Along with teaching a full schedule of dance classes, ranging from social dance and clogging to world dance, West also directed performing groups that traveled to Germany, China, New Zealand, Russia and Spain.


West was influential in the development of the folk dance division in the Department of Theatre and Dance and in the implementation of a dance major at the university.


He has served on a number of boards, including the Fine Arts Endowment at Ricks College and the National Folk Organization of the United States. West was also on the founding committee for the Rexburg International Folk Dance Festival and supported Together for Greatness.
